title: The Adopted Dallas Woman Who Found Family on the Other Side of the World
excerpt: A herd of elephants halfway around the world gave an adopted Dallas woman the home she always wanted.

title: The Despotism of Isaias Afewerki | Alex de Waal
excerpt: Afewerki’s attack on Tigray is the culmination of the Eritrean dictator’s ambition to become master of the Horn of Africa.

title: The Incredible Journey of Three African Wild Dogs
excerpt: Three sisters braved lions, crocodiles, poachers, raging rivers and other dangers on a 1,300-mile transnational effort to forge a new dynasty.

title: The Awe-Inspiring But Tragic Story of Africa’s Festival In The Desert (2001
excerpt: Nenad Georgievski writes at All About Jazz, though the world knew little about Malian music until American musicians began partnering with players from West Africa. In the 1980s, Stevie Wonder began touring with Amadou and Mariam, helping to popularize their form of Malian blues.

title: The art dealer, the £10m Benin Bronze and the Holocaust
excerpt: Western museums are under pressure to return looted treasure, but what of those in private collections?
